trans-unit.source: The DirectoryControlCollection class manages a collection of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> objects.
The DirectoryControlCollection constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> class.
The Add method adds a new <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object to the collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object to add.

The index of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> at which the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object has been added.
control is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
The AddRange method adds an array of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> objects to the collection.
An array of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> objects to add to the collection.
controls is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
A member of the array is a null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic).
The AddRange method adds a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> object to the current collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> object to add to this collection.
controlCollection is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

The Contains method determines whether this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> object contains a specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object for which to search.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object is part of the collection; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, otherwise.
The CopyTo method copies the entire collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
A one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> object.
The zero-based index of `array` where copying begins.
array is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional -or- The number of elements in the source is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
The type of the source cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.

The IndexOf method returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object for which the index is returned.
The index value of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object, if found; otherwise, -1.

The Insert method inserts the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object into the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> at the specified index.
The index in the collection at which to insert the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object to be inserted into the collection.
value is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
index is less than zero, or index is greater than the number of elements in the object.

<xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> is read-only, or <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
The Item property contains the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object at the specified index.
The index value of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object.
Contains the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object at the specified index.
There was an attempt to set the property to <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The OnValidate method verifies that value is a object.
This method does not return a value.
Instead, an exception is thrown if the specified object is null or is not a valid <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl> object.
The object to evaluate.
value is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
value is not a object.
The Remove method removes the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object from the collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl"></xref> object to remove.

<xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> is read-only, or <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
